newsitem.title: UK: Bayoil said seeking tonnage for Iraq in mid-August.
newsitem.headline: Bayoil said seeking tonnage for Iraq in mid-August.

text.p: U.S. trading house Bayoil are seeking Very Large Crude Carriers (VLCCs) to take Iraqi crude oil from the port of Mina al-Bakr around the middle of August in anticipation of the expected resumption of Iraqi oil exports under a U.N. oil-for-food deal, shipbrokers said.

"The last we heard was that Bayoil was looking for something, one or two ships, for around mid-August," one broker said. "As far as I know, they are negotiating at the moment but they have not agreed anything yet."
He said one potential candidate for Iraqi crude was the 270,000 deadweight tonne vessel Knock More, built in 1974, and was more likely to sail West to Europe or the United States than to the East.
